thread.title: Chewy's Adorable Cactus Scratcher Is a Total Hit
thread.title_full: Chewy's Adorable Cactus Scratcher Is a Total Hit

author: Alexandra Jump
title: Chewy's Adorable Cactus Scratcher Is a Total Hit
text:
PetHelpful aims to feature only the best products and services. If you buy something via one of our links, we may earn a commission.
If your cat’s idea of entertainment is anything like mine, it involves scaling your favorite piece of furniture and claiming every surface as their personal scratching gym. Trying to protect your favorite couch while also impressing your fur baby can be a real struggle. Luckily, Chewy has found a way to keep both you, your cat and your furniture happy!
The Frisco Cactus Cat Scratching Post from Chewy is a delightfully quirky piece that is part modern art and part feline playground. Available in three sizes—22-inch, 31-inch, and 33-inch—and wrapped in sisal rope, this faux cactus brings the spirit of the Southwest right to your living room. The plush green fabric provides your cat with the perfect spot to rub, stretch and sharpen their claws, while adding a fun pop of color to your space. It is easy to assemble, so your cat can enjoy playtime immediately while also being stable enough for even the toughest of friends.
Chewy’s Personalized Pet Mug Lets You Sip With Your Favorite Face Every Morning
Coffee tastes better when your dog’s face is on the mug.
Dai Poole
Frisco Cactus Cat Scratching Post, 22-in, $16.01 at Chewy
With a 4.6-star rating and thousands of glowing reviews, it’s clear this scratcher is more than just a cute accent piece; it is a feline favorite! One happy reviewer shared, “Our cats love this thing. It’s tall, and they love stretching up full length to scratch at it. They seem to enjoy both the sisal rope and the cloth/carpeted pieces. We humans love the green color and how cute the faux cactus is. It took about a year to scratch up the first one, so we have bought two more, one for each room the cats spend most of their time in. We get lots of compliments on the cacti. I like that we can hang things from the cactus arms so the kitties can self-play when we are busy.”
While another wrote, “Needed to replace an old scratching post, and this unique one was an eye-catcher and no brainer since we live in a desert area. My cats took to it immediately, making it easy to remove the old favorite, and trusty one they had completely destroyed. They have a lot of posts throughout the house, but this looks like the front runner at the moment. It’s pretty sturdy and well made, so a fairly long life is expected.”
On sale for just $16.01, this sturdy, stylish and desert chic cat post may just become your cat’s newest obsession. Whether they are scaling it like a mountain lion or batting at the hanging pom poms for hours, this Frisco Cactus Scratcher turns every day scratching into a feline fiesta.
Grab yours now on the Chewy website while it is still blooming, because the only thing better than a cat-approved toy is one that doubles as home decor!
Chewy Shoppers Say This Tuna-Flavored Cat Supplement Is a Game Changer for Digestion
Tuna-flavored probiotic cats can’t resist.
Dai Poole
About the author
Alexandra Jump
Pet News Writer
